metadata.title: CVE-2023-3389 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux Kernel io_uring subsystem canbe exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. Racing a io_uringcancel poll request with a linked timeout can cause a UAF in a hrtimer. Werecommend upgrading past commit ef7dfac51d8ed961b742218f526bd589f3900a59(4716c73b188566865bdd79c3a6709696a224ac04 for 5.10 stable and0e388fce7aec40992eadee654193cad345d62663 for 5.15 stable).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3389` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
